TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies the properties that support lookup-based binding. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute is used to specify the properties used with lookup-based binding, particularly <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> controls.
The LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute is specified at the class level. The class can be inherited and does not allow multiple attributes on the same class.
## Examples The following code example shows properties used with lookup-based binding.
[!code-cs[System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.componentmodel._19_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.componentmodel._19_1.vb)]
The LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute attribute must include all four members, except when unsetting values. The following code example shows the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control.
[!code-cs[System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.componentmodel._19_2.cs)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.componentmodel._19_2.vb)]
The following code example shows that a control can support both simple binding as well as list binding.
[!code-cs[System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.componentmodel._19_3.cs)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.componentmodel._19_3.vb)]
The following code example shows that the LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute attribute can be unset by specifying no arguments.
[!code-cs[System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.componentmodel._19_4.cs)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.componentmodel._19_4.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using no parameters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default constructor sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute.DataSource%2A>, <xref:System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute.DisplayMember%2A>, <xref:System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute.ValueMember%2A>, and <xref:System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute.LookupMember%2A> properties to `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: public LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute (string dataSource, string displayMember, string valueMember, string lookupMember);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string dataSource, string displayMember, string valueMember, string lookupMember) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property to be used as the data source.
The name of the property to be used for the display name.
The name of the property to be used as the source for values.
The name of the property to be used for lookups.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor sets each of its public properties to the corresponding supplied parameter; for example, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute.DataSource%2A> property is set to `dataSource`.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the data source property for the component to which the is bound.
Docs.value: The data source property for the component to which the is bound.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The DataSource property is set in the constructors for this class.

Docs.summary: Represents the default value for the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Default member is a static, read-only field that defines an instance of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute> class initialized with the default constructor.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the display member property for the component to which the is bound.
Docs.value: The name of the display member property for the component to which the is bound.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The DisplayMember property is set in the constructors for this class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Object> to compare with the current instance
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified <xref:System.Object> is equal to the current instance.
Docs.returns: if the object is equal to the current instance; otherwise, , indicating they are not equal.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Equals method returns `true` if the `obj` parameter is of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute> and all the public properties—<xref:System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute.DataSource%2A>, <xref:System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute.DisplayMember%2A>, <xref:System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute.ValueMember%2A>, and <xref:System.ComponentModel.LookupBindingPropertiesAttribute.LookupMember%2A>—are equal to each other.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
Docs.returns: A hash code for the current .

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the lookup member for the component to which this attribute is bound.
Docs.value: The name of the lookup member for the component to which the is bound.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The LookupMember property is set in the constructors for this class.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the value member property for the component to which the is bound.
Docs.value: The name of the value member property for the component to which the is bound.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ValueMember property is set in the constructors for this class.
